snippet: The Transportation Security Administration said the maker of the scanners failed to meet a deadline for new software that protected passengers’ privacy.
abstract: Transportation Security Administration says it will begin removing controversial full-body scanners that produce revealing images of airline travelers beginning summer 2013; has canceled contract with Rapiscan, maker of scanners, after it failed to meet Congressional deadline for new software that would protect passengers’ privacy.
lead_paragraph: The Transportation Security Administration said the maker of the scanners failed to meet a deadline for new software that protected passengers’ privacy.

headline.seo: T.S.A. To Remove Invasive Body Scanners
headline.main: Unpopular Full-Body Scanners to Be Removed From Airports
headline.print_headline: Unpopular Full-Body Scanners To Be Removed From Airports
